shorts.title: Charles Hangen Joins Fidelity Bank as Senior Vice President and Chief Risk Officer
shorts.title_distilled: Charles Hangen Joins Fidelity Bank as Senior Vice President and Chief Risk Officer.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Daniel J. Santaniello, President and CEO of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce that Charles Hangen has joined Fidelity Bank as SVP, Chief Risk Officer.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Daniel J. Santaniello, President and CEO of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce that Charles Hangen has joined Fidelity Bank as SVP, Chief Risk Officer.

shorts.description: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II (ACH Gen II) production contract (SPE1C1-23-D-0004) awarded to Gentex Corporation. Valued at up t…
shorts.content: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II (ACH Gen II) production contract (SPE1C1-23-D-0004) awarded to Gentex Corporation. Valued at up t…
shorts.content_distilled: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency  has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II  production contract  awarded to Gentex Corporation.

shorts.title: Swap, not shop at Snow Much Fun Day
shorts.title_distilled: Swap, not shop at Snow Much Fun Day.
shorts.description: A Dec. 6 clothing swap is part of Snow Much Fun Day at the Everhart Museum, in Nay Aug Park, Scranton. A later benefit will combine recycled fashion and art to benefit charity.

shorts.title: HS SWIMMING: Scranton Prep girls, Abington Heights boys seek league titles
shorts.title_distilled: HS SWIMMING: Scranton Prep girls, Abington Heights boys seek league titles.
shorts.description: There is an abundance of talent ready to dive into the pool for the Lackawanna League season. Elk Lake girls are the defending champions after breaking Scranton Prep’s 73-meet league winning streak. Scranton Prep, however, is the favorite to reclaim the girls’ title. Abington Heights, last season’s District 2 Class 3A team champion, is expected to challenge the Classics. Abington Heights is the slight favorite to dethrone Delaware Valley in the Lackawanna League race. Both Times-Tribune Swimmers of the Year headline a group of returning All-Region athletes who should make for an intense winter competition. Scranton Prep’s Rebecca Oakles was […]
shorts.content: There is an abundance of talent ready to dive into the pool for the Lackawanna League season. Elk Lake girls are the defending champions after breaking Scranton Prep’s 73-meet league winning streak. Scranton Prep, however, is the favorite to reclaim the girls’ title. Abington Heights, last season’s District 2 Class 3A team champion, is expected to challenge the Classics. Abington Heights is the slight favorite to dethrone Delaware Valley in the Lackawanna League race. Both Times-Tribune Swimmers of the Year headline a group of returning All-Region athletes who should make for an intense winter competition. Scranton Prep’s Rebecca Oakles was […]
shorts.content_distilled: There is an abundance of talent ready to dive into the pool for the Lackawanna League season.

shorts.title: School Notes, November 30, 2025
shorts.description: Abington Heights Clarks Summit Elementary School third graders Kiva and Keyan Patel performed a traditional dance during the Diwali celebration at St. Mary’s Center in Scranton on Nov. 15. The event drew approximately 400 attendees who gathered to mark Diwali, the festival of lights that represents the triumph of light over darkness, knowledge over ignorance and good over evil. The evening featured cultural performances and a dinner served to all guests. Keyan said, “I felt happy after performing,” while Kiva said she “felt nervous and happy because I was in the front during the performance.” They both like playing with […]

shorts.title: REMEMBER WHEN
shorts.description: 30 years ago North Pocono overcame a five-point deficit after three quarters to defeat Valley View, 40-34, in a girls basketball season opener. Rita Yanulaitis led the rally, scoring 12 of her game-high 28 points in the fourth quarter when the Lady Trojans outscored the Cougars, 19-8. … Scranton Prep made coach Canio Cianci’s return to the high school ranks a successful one with a 65-46 win over Sacred Heart. Chris Glenn and Chris Skoff each scored 19 points for the Cavaliers. Matt Seitzinger added 11 points. … Lackawanna College lost to Georgia Military, 48-15, in the Huddle House Golden […]
shorts.content: 30 years ago North Pocono overcame a five-point deficit after three quarters to defeat Valley View, 40-34, in a girls basketball season opener. Rita Yanulaitis led the rally, scoring 12 of her game-high 28 points in the fourth quarter when the Lady Trojans outscored the Cougars, 19-8. … Scranton Prep made coach Canio Cianci’s return to the high school ranks a successful one with a 65-46 win over Sacred Heart. Chris Glenn and Chris Skoff each scored 19 points for the Cavaliers. Matt Seitzinger added 11 points. … Lackawanna College lost to Georgia Military, 48-15, in the Huddle House Golden […]
